name: Little House in the Big Woods Part 2 Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: When Pa ran into a bear on his way back from town, what did the bear turn out to be?
questions.explanation:
a stump.

	When Pa was coming back from town, it started getting dark on him.  In the shadows he saw what he thought was a bear.  He was terrified since he did not have his gun.  After a standoff that seemed to take forever he ran after the bear with a big stick.  When he got to the bear it turned out to be an old burned black stump.

a dress.

	Ma's delaine dress was dark green, with a pattern all over it that looked like ripe strawberries.  Laura had never seen Ma wear it before.  When ma said she was wearing it to the sugaring off dance, Laura knew the dance must be something special.

questions.text: Who won the jigging contest, Grandma or Uncle George?
questions.explanation:
Grandma.

	When Grandma and Uncle George got into the jigging contest everyone told him he could not beat Grandma.  After several minutes and being almost breathless, George threw up his arms and said, "I'm beat."  Grandma jigged a couple of more minutes.  The jig is a type of dance.

questions.text: What did Mary and Laura use for a playhouse in  the summer?
questions.explanation:
two big trees.

	There were two big oak trees in the front yard.  Mary had her tree and Laura had hers.  The soft grass made a nice carpet for them.  They also had a swing hanging from a low branch on Laura's tree.

questions.text: How many miles was it from Laura's house to town?
questions.explanation:
7.

	The town was named Pepin.  It was on the shore of Lake Pepin.

questions.text: What kind of candy did the store keeper give to Mary and Laura?
questions.explanation:
candy hearts.

	Mary's heart said, "Roses are red, Violets are blue, Sugar is sweet, and So are you."  Laura's said, "Sweets to the sweet."

questions.text: When they went to town, Mary picked up so many pebbles that the pocket tore from her dress when Pa picked her up and put her in the wagon.
questions.explanation:
False.

	That was Laura.  ma assured her the dress could be easily mended.  Ma said, "And another time, don't be so greedy."

questions.correct: Mary said golden hair was prettier than brown
options: Mary wouldn't give Charlotte back to Laura
Mary told on Laura for not picking up the wood chips
questions.explanation:
Mary said golden hair was prettier than brown.

	Laura always thought Mary's hair was prettier than her own.  When Mary said that golden hair was prettier than brown, Laura, who was already tired and cross, reached up and slapped her.  Pa had to spank Laura.  The only good thing Laura felt happened that evening was that Mary had to pick up all the wood chips herself.  That was a chore they both hated.

questions.text: In order to make cheese, Ma had to have rennet.  What is rennet?
questions.correct: the lining of a young calf's stomach
options: the lining of a young lamb's stomach
the lining of a young deer's stomach
the lining of a young pig's stomach
questions.explanation:
the lining of a young calf's stomach.

	The calf had to be very young, so that it had never eaten anything but milk.

questions.text: What bread of today is similar to johnnycake?
questions.explanation:
cornbread.

	Johnnycake was made from cornmeal.  Laura asked Ma why it was called johnnycake.  Ma said that she did not know, unless the Northern soldiers called it that because the people in the South ate so much of it.
